intro: Cyrtandra macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited cyrtandra, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a flowering plant characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. Native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine, though its primary botanical interest lies in its floral structure and ecological role.
